pullRequest.title: Clean up variable scoping in the user tree
pullRequest.bodyText: This PR cleans up variable scoping in the user tree by renaming Locals to Scope, removing variable slotting from the user tree (now part of the ir tree), and removing specialization of parameters which individual user nodes are now responsible for. The new scopes also track variable usage, so in a follow up PR, the extractVariables pass will be removed as with a bit more work it's no longer necessary.

commit.message: redo variable scoping to remove need for extract variables pass

nodes.bodyText: Should this be isFinal to better match nomenclature in java?

Could you please add comments throughout these scope classes on the differences between each scope's behavior? There are slight differences between each scope and it is not obvious what the reasons are for those differences.

Maybe we could use "used" terminology instead of "read from", as the latter is difficult to read (is it "reed" or "red"). I would also just have it called "used" or "usedVariables", not "areUsed" since "are" and "is" imply the type should be boolean. Also can you please add a comment explaining the semantics (eg used means getVariable was called for that name).
